Legal_Issue: Failure to consider evidence of lack of state protection in Mexico
Outcome: Claim initially dismissed by the Board
Evidence_Type: Evidence of corruption and ineffectiveness of Mexican authorities
Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Inability to access state protection in home country (Mexico)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Effectiveness of state protection mechanisms in Mexico
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection claim and judicial review
Regulation_Cited: Sections 96 and 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Error: Failure to address contradictory evidence regarding state protection
Review_Outcome: Decision quashed and remanded for reconsideration
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence showing corruption and inability of Mexican authorities to protect citizens
Legal_Standard: Burden on claimant to prove lack of state protection
Application_Factor: Existence and effectiveness of state protection mechanisms
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board unreasonably failed to consider evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Sections 96 and 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Cause_of_Refusal: Belief that adequate state protection existed in Mexico
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 96 and 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidentiary_Issues: Board ignored evidence contradicting its conclusion
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to consider all relevant evidence may undermine fairness
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of Board's decision
Jurisdictional_Focus: Mexico as country of alleged state protection
Procedural_Issue: Incomplete assessment of evidence by administrative body
